intro: Zanthoxylum deremense, commonly known as the African prickly ash, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the Rutaceae family and is characterized by its compound leaves and spiny twigs. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that develop into red, fleshy berries. Zanthoxylum deremense is often found in woodland and savanna habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. Its botanical features make it an important component of the ecosystems it inhabits.
